Package edu.neu.ccis.sms.servlets.members

Servlet implementation classes for serving requests specific to members

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AddMemberServlet
    Add new member; addition of new members is hierarchy based; Members can only be added as child members of existing members.
    AddRoleToMemberServlet
    Adds new role for a user identified by its email id on the given member, if such a user-role-member mapping does not already exist.
    CreateMemberServlet
    Create a new member based on the category attributes specified in the terminology xml and the values provided by the user for these attributes.
    CreateNewMemberFormServlet
    Create a new member html form from the application terminology, based on its category and parent member, providing user with the controls to submit this form and create a new member.
    DashboardServlet
    Show all the active registrations for the user on their dashboard, arranged by the roles user has on the members.
    ReadActiveMembersServlet
    Read all the active child members for the given category and parent member id, presenting these members formatted as values of a select box.
    ReadMemberDetailsServlet
    Read all the attributes for the current member providing view only access; for conductors provide additional functionality to edit/update member attributes, add role for user on member and activate/ inactivate a member.
    ReadMembersServlet
    Read all the child members for the given category and parent member id, representing these members formatted as values of a select box.
    ReadSubmittablesForMemberServlet
    Read all the child submittables for the given member, represented as an unordered list, sorted by their name.
    RegisterForMemberServlet
    Register for an active registerable member, for a specific role,

    Retrieves data asynchronously from following api-urls
    1.
    RegisterUserForMemberServlet
    Register current user for a given member with given role, if such a user-role-member mapping does not already exist.
    ToggleMemberActivationServlet
    Toggle activation status (active/inactive) for a member and enforce parent's new activation state on all its children.
    UpdateMemberServlet
    Update the new details for the member; with the restriction that the updated child member name should be unique for its direct parent member.
    ViewMemberDetailsServlet
    Provide view only member details, for users with conductor access provide additional functionality to edit member, add role for user to member, activate/inactivate member.
    ViewRegistrableMemberServlet
    Show view only details for a registerable member, along with option to view submittables.
    ViewSubmittableMemberServlet
    Show view only details for a submittable member, along with user role specific actions.
